alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Letcher (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 28 at 3:46AM EST until January 29 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow mixed with freezing drizzle is expected, mainly for locations at 2500 feet elevation and above. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 inches and ice accumulations of a trace to one tenth of an inch. Winds may also gust as high as 30 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Harlan and Letcher Counties. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 7 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Although some locations below 2500 could experience a slushy accumulation of snow on grassy and elevated surfaces, travel impacts are possible for locations at 2500 feet and above. Some roadways that cross Pine and Black Mountains that could be affected include US 421, US 119, KY 160, KY 38, and KY 179.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Kentucky can be found by visiting https://goky.ky.gov.
